text: Hey Matt sure can have a look do you have an example page that’s having problems with layout shifts?

I am breaking up the workflows into a modular fashion, with each workflow only looking at a subset of sites fields. HS also have a feature to send custom JSON responses too, which I will be using in due course to only send the info needed instead of the entire user profile. This should work for us and make it easier to manage as well as not having over 300 enrolment triggers on a single workflow which causes browser tabs to lock up due to the amount of things there.

• Be inclusive (try not to say, "Hey guys, hey boys, hey [any specific group]")

Want to report a violation? DM <@UQNEXHW14> or fill out the <https://form.asana.com/?k=p7aM0fpd3G4JGETDL_nYXg&d=8587152060687|anonymous form here>.

Is it possible to include a consent checkbox in a quote template?

We just need to add a checkbox that the user has to click before being able to sign the quote, and that checkbox needs to update that property on the contact.
Hi Sasha, i have done exactly that for a client a couple of months ago
Nice. How did you do it? Did you use a form? Or did you do some sort of API call? or some other feature unique to quote templates?
a checkbox that gets rid of a div that lies on top off the  button and also changes the  pointer events: none so it can accept the click
i was hoping for a property update, but if they sign the quote, that implies they clicked the checkbox!
but what if you wanted to let them print a copy?
there is a download button that you can have on your quote (native to HubSpot forms)...you could disable /hide that as well and make it only appear when the checkbox is checked
and then the contact gets a copy of the signed quote via email. would it be possible to have the checkbox marked there?
let's say we trigger a workflow to update a contact property, would that show up on the emailed quote?
i'm just thinking about the legal implications here
